alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 02 at 8:42PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR THE ISLAND OF MAUI IN MAUI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Maui in Maui County. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 841 PM HST, radar indicated showers diminishing in intensity and coverage over windward Maui. Ponding and runoff continues, but is expected to gradually diminish. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Keanae, Haliimaile, Kipahulu, Kaupo, Huelo, Nahiku, Pauwela, Paia, Hana and Haleakala National Park. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 1030 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
